item.title: More math typesetting
item.description:
Here’s some math typesetting stuff. For starters I’ll just write down the Linblad equation, a nice bit of physics for open quantum systems,

$$ \frac{\partial \rho(t)}{\partial t} = \sum_j \gamma_j \left( L_j \rho(t) L_j^\dagger -\frac{1}{2} \lbrace L_j^\dagger L_j, \rho(t)\rbrace\right) -\lbrack H, \rho(t) \rbrack ~ .$$

Hello \(x\).

Does \(v = \nu a\)? How do \(g\), \(u\), \(v\) and v, \(w\), and \(z\) look? This is slightly unrelated to the Lindblad equation, since it’s classical, but I’m the God of this document, so I’ll also write down the Boltzmann equation,
